XTS is XEX-based Tweaked CodeBook mode (TCB) with CipherText Stealing (CTS).

It is used for disk encryption and is the NIST current recommend block cipher mode for confidentiality on storage devices. It is also the IEEE Std 1619-2007 standard.

http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-38E/nist-sp-800-38E.pdf
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disk_encryption_theory#XTS

Reproducible: Always

comments.text:
Nelson, libDiskEncrpt. ;-)

I have done more investigation and realize now that XTS only needs CKM_AES_ECB from PK11. XTS can be implemented using PK11 now without additional enhancement.

Details are in the following pdf.
http://axelkenzo.ru/downloads/1619-2007-NIST-Submission.pdf

It would be great to get it implemented by the nss group so that it can be FIPS certified. However, I won't object if this enhancement request is closed as wontfix.
